intro: Hymenandra stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hymenandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
